text:
Indian equity benchmarks snapped an eight day gaining streak in early trading today.The S&P BSE Sensex Index fell as much as 0.25 percent to 33,639.32, while the NSE Nifty 50 Index also fell as much as 0.26 percent to 10,372.25.The market breadth was tilted in favour of the buyers. Ten of the 19 sector gauges compiled by the BSE Ltd. fell led by the S&P BSE Energy Index falling 0.41 percent. On the flipside, the S&P BSE Healthcare Index rose 0.44 percent, making it the best performer.






Here Are The Stocks Moving The Market This Morning:






Bharat 22 ETF: Debut TradeShares of Bharat-22 Exchange Traded Fund rose 3.6 percent on the Bombay Stock Exchange after making their stock market debut at Rs 36.3 apiece on Tuesday.The government has raised Rs 14,500 crore through the open-ended exchange traded fund, comprising 22 stocks. The ETF saw bids of nearly Rs 32,000 crore coming in. (More details here!)






IDBI Bank: Stake Sale In NSEShares of the lender extended its five-day gaining streak after it rose as much as 2.98 percent to Rs 63.95.The board of the state-run bank approved the sale of 74 lakh shares, or 1.5 percent stake, in National Stock Exchange.The stock is 29 percent above the Bloomberg consensus one-year target price. It has declined 8.93 percent, making it the only loser in the Nifty PSU Bank Index so far this year.






Punjab National Bank: Sells Stake In PNB Housing FinanceShares of the New Delhi-based bank rose as much as 1.08 percent -- first time in four sessions -- to Rs 187.85The lender said it will sell up to 99.94 lakh shares in PNB Housing Finance via offer for sale. The stock has returned 62.1 percent as compared to Nifty PSU Bank Index’s return of 34.66 percent this year.






SREI Infra Finance: IPO Via Offer For SaleShares of the non-banking financial institution extended a four-day gaining streak as it rose as much as 4.66 percent.The company will sell 43.9 lakh shares of its unit SREI Equipment Finance Ltd. via an initial public offering, according to its exchange filing.The stock’s trading volume was six times its 20-day average in early trading. The analyst consensus rating was equivalent to a strong buy, according to Bloomberg.






Reliance Communications: Falls On CDB’s Insolvency SuitShares of the Anil Ambani-led telecom company fell as much as 9.4 percent to Rs 12.10.The stock was down for a fourth straight session after China Development Bank initiated insolvency proceedings against the company. In its response, the telecom operator said that it was surprised by the 'untimely and premature action' of the Chinese lender. (More details here!).Meanwhile, the ADAG group agreed to sell its DTH business to Pantel Tech and Veecon Media for an undisclosed amount to cut down on liabilities.






Rallis India: Rises After Franklin Templeton MF Buys StakeShares of the agri-chemicals maker rose as much as 7.12 percent -- its highest intraday jump in nearly two months -- to Rs 246.75. Global fund Franklin Templeton MF bought 0.9 percent stakes in Rallis India Ltd. Trading volume was 3.4 times more than its three-month full-day average.
title: Stocks Radar: Bharat 22 ETF, Reliance Communications, IDBI Bank
